name: Culinary Institute of America
description: World-renowned culinary school with multiple campuses. The Hyde Park campus features award-winning restaurants and cooking demonstrations.

name: Strong Museum of Play
description: The world's only museum devoted entirely to the history and exploration of play. Features the National Toy Hall of Fame and interactive exhibits.

name: Corning Museum of Glass
description: World's largest glass museum with over 50,000 glass objects spanning 3,500 years. Features live glassmaking demonstrations and the Rakow Research Library.

name: Storm King Art Center
description: 500-acre outdoor sculpture park featuring large-scale contemporary art installations set against the backdrop of the Hudson Highlands.

name: Bethel Woods Center for the Arts
description: Built on the site of the 1969 Woodstock Festival. Features a museum dedicated to the 1960s and a performing arts center with outdoor amphitheater.

name: Cooperstown Baseball Hall of Fame
description: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum, celebrating the history and heroes of America's pastime.

name: Fenimore Art Museum
description: Premier American art museum featuring folk art, American Indian art, and Hudson River School paintings in a beautiful lakeside setting.

name: Olana State Historic Site
description: Home and studio of Frederic Edwin Church, one of the most prominent American landscape painters of the 19th century.

name: Dia:Beacon
description: Contemporary art museum housed in a former Nabisco box-printing facility, featuring large-scale installations and minimal art.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library and Museum
description: The first presidential library in the United States, preserving the legacy of FDR and Eleanor Roosevelt.

name: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site
description: Gilded Age mansion showcasing the opulent lifestyle of the Vanderbilt family, with stunning Hudson River views.

name: West Point Military Academy
description: Historic military academy founded in 1802, training America's future military leaders. Features stunning Hudson River views and historic architecture.

name: Woodstock Artists Association & Museum
description: Historic art colony and museum celebrating the Woodstock art movement and contemporary artists in the Catskills.

name: Howe Caverns
description: One of the most popular cave systems in the Northeast, featuring underground boat rides and spectacular limestone formations.

name: Saratoga Performing Arts Center
description: Outdoor amphitheater and cultural center hosting the New York City Ballet, Philadelphia Orchestra, and major concerts.

name: National Museum of Racing and Hall of Fame
description: Celebrating the history of thoroughbred racing in America, featuring interactive exhibits and the Hall of Fame.

name: George Eastman Museum
description: World's oldest photography museum and one of the oldest film archives, housed in George Eastman's historic mansion.

name: Seneca Falls National Women's Rights Historical Park
description: Birthplace of the women's rights movement, featuring the Wesleyan Chapel where the first Women's Rights Convention was held.

name: Watkins Glen International
description: Historic road racing circuit known as 'The Glen,' hosting NASCAR, IndyCar, and other major racing events.

name: Letchworth State Park - The Grand Canyon of the East
description: Spectacular gorge with three major waterfalls, often called the 'Grand Canyon of the East' for its dramatic scenery.

name: Niagara Falls State Park
description: America's oldest state park, home to the world-famous Niagara Falls with spectacular views and boat tours.

name: Albany Institute of History & Art
description: One of the oldest museums in the United States, featuring Hudson River School paintings and regional history.

name: Sagamore Hill National Historic Site
description: Home of Theodore Roosevelt, 26th President of the United States, featuring the 'Summer White House' and nature trails.

name: Old Westbury Gardens
description: Magnificent English-style country estate with formal gardens, featuring the historic Westbury House and 200 acres of landscaped grounds.

name: Storm King State Park
description: Mountain park offering spectacular views of the Hudson Valley, featuring hiking trails and the famous Storm King Mountain.

name: Adirondack Experience - The Museum on Blue Mountain Lake
description: Comprehensive museum celebrating Adirondack history, culture, and wilderness, featuring historic buildings and outdoor exhibits.

name: Wild Center
description: Natural history museum and science center dedicated to the Adirondacks, featuring interactive exhibits and outdoor trails.

name: Roberson Museum and Science Center
description: Regional museum featuring local history, science exhibits, and the Kopernik Observatory for astronomy education.

name: Munson-Williams-Proctor Arts Institute
description: Premier art museum featuring American and European art, with a focus on 19th and 20th century works in a beautiful historic setting.

name: Erie Canal Museum
description: Museum dedicated to the history of the Erie Canal, featuring historic boats, interactive exhibits, and the only remaining weighlock building.

name: Saratoga National Historical Park
description: Site of the pivotal 1777 Battle of Saratoga, often called the 'Turning Point of the American Revolution.'

name: Fort Ticonderoga
description: Historic fort that played crucial roles in the French and Indian War and American Revolution, with living history demonstrations.

name: Hyde Hall
description: Neoclassical mansion built in the early 19th century, representing one of the finest examples of Federal architecture in America.
